text: Hey <@UEC65BQV8>, so a coded file isn't currently able to be swapped, even with the new beta, however, adding the `dnd_area` like you said makes into a coded file with DND area, which would be the end result of this new beta. You're right that we have 3 categories of templates right now: DND templates, coded files, and coded files with dnd areas and it's a little strange how hard the lines are between them (especially considering that all it takes to go from coded file -> coded file with DND area is the addition of that `dnd_area` tag), but we're definitely pushing everyone towards using coded files with DND areas as it provides the best page editing experience
Thanks for clarifying. I See the difference now. I thought I had some bug on my end!
If you're looking to turn your existing templates into theme templates, <https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/add-theme-features-to-existing-sites> can show you how to do it
It's outputting the row and column - but not module. I'm not getting syntax errors, but I'm clearly missing something. Also - I know the module works, as I can add in my page builder.
